column5: my Bro, Tinbanger and myself made it out today 9-10 pike caught and released  had to take shelter on shore... well swamp haha for a little while do to lightening! but the fish were on the feed!!
I had really bad luck or good luck, My wife had to work so I have both troublemakers with me this weekend.  No fishing and no desire in that weather
Anyone get out today in this awesome weather where having right now.  Or are you waiting for Sunday?  I might just chill around the house, don't really want to get the rain coat wet.
We've had some serious lightning here in Stratford, and a few downpours with extra large hailstones to spice up the mix. Hope nobody got caught out on the water in that mess.  JF
was out on cooks today for about 4hrs no hits just lots of rain and a few lightning chased me off  the water. till tomorrow. hopefully...;-)
We keep getting thunderstorm after thunderstorm here in Richmond Hill.  Fishing rod in hand vs. lightening = no thanks  Joey

If I didn't have my wisdom teeth taken out the other day and I was feeling well I would be out there fishing right now...from shore of course, bought my self a nice rain suit last fall and only got out to use it once
Sky's clearing here in Stratford now (noon) and that appears to be moving your way.  JF

Ya, it did that twice here too already John, then up popped another storm.  Actually, as we speak here comes another.  I believe these are just pop ups because if you look at the radar, its clear one minute, then storms the next.  I'll just go shopping.  I'll sacrifice
Bass Pro?  JF
I was fishing a Kawartha lake for walleye but the rain and the lightening sent me packing  too bad the walleye were biting pretty good
Yep we got out but the lightening put us off the water at a little after 9am.  We did get our limit of herring though.
I got out.. to the hangar.. today, to put the finishing touches on my latest back lake helper...   Skunked again eh Glen....
If this keeps up i am going have to take up golf.  With the lightening and the rain maybe knitting would be better.
I was supposed to be out today but plans didn't work out as i'd hoped. That being said, one of my buddies just called and he was already on his way back home due to the downpours and lightning.

Mid-afternoon, it's getting dark, windy and cold here. At least I had a long enuf dry spell to cut the lawn. Think I finished just in time.  Now I have a good excuse to stay in & replace a few crappy trebles with the Gamakatsus (sp?) that I just picked up.  JF

I waited until the storm was practically right over my head today.  Why does that always happen? "Just one more cast.  I mean it this time." "MY BAITS TANGLED THAT ONE DOESN'T COUNT" "I JUST HAD A HIT I HAVE TO CAST BACK!"
Fishing is less frustrating.  JF
Well back from shopping - still thundering.  We even had hail a few minutes ago  No John, BPS was last weekend     I should buy stock in that company
I managed to get to the river today ...went one for one ....and quit cuz i didnt bring a raincoat and i was soaked....was worth it though cuz the little bow put on quit a show in the rain..
woke up at 4am... checked the satellite images..big storm coming in. back to bed..

Looking out the window, waves of rain blowing across the lake so hard at times I can hardly see my boat house, lightning, gusting winds and there are still boats out there, after all these years I can't figure out why no one ever seems to take a strike. I love fishing but not that much!
Yea i see there where a couple of hardcore diehards out, you guys are nuts.  Tomorrow is my time to shine woot woot
One hour of chores, followed by a one hour storm break; repear, repeat, repeat.  Sure was tough keeping the BBQ lit.
me and the girlfriend got out today from about 11 till 1:30 we got 2 walleye and 2 smallmouth
Keenen, welcome! What area of the lake were you fishing? I live on Snug Harbour Rd. near the Moorings Marina.
Got out today. Fished the lake at Charles Daly park near St. Kits. Weather was not that bad. Some rain not too heavy, no lightening but fairly windy. Two dinky bullheads was all that I caught.
